entities.name: detention
entities.description: The detention with Dolores Umbridge is mentioned as a consequence of Harry's actions.

entities.name: dolores umbridge
entities.description: Dolores Umbridge is the one who is giving Harry detention. She is described as watching him with a smile on her face.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character who is receiving detention from Dolores Umbridge.

entities.name: parchment
entities.description: The parchment is where Harry writes the words 'I must not tell lies' in what appears to be shining red ink.

entities.name: quill
entities.description: The quill is the writing instrument used by Harry to write on the parchment.

relationships.description: Dolores Umbridge gives Harry detention, as mentioned in the text: 'The words had appeared on the parchment in what appeared to be shining red ink. At the same time, the words had appeared on the back of  Harry’s right hand, cut into his skin as though traced there by a sc alpel — yet even as he stared at the shining cut, the skin healed over again, leaving the place where it had been slightly redder than before but quite smooth. ... He looked around at Umbrid ge. She was watching him, her wide, toadlike mouth st retched in a smile.'
